content: व्यसनं {@--1@} Casting away, dispelling. {@--2@} Separating, dividing. {@--3@} Violation, infraction. {@--4@} Loss, destruction, defeat, fall; defection, weak point; अमात्यव्यसनं <ls>Pt. 3</ls>; स्वबलव्यसने <ls>Ki. 13. 15</ls>; <ls>Śi. 2. 57.</ls> {@--5@} ({%a%}) A calamity, misfortune, distress, evil, disaster' ill-luck; अज्ञातभर्तृव्यसना मुहूर्तं कृतोपकारेव रतिर्बभूव <ls>Ku. 3. 73</ls>, <ls n="Ku.">4. 30</ls>; <ls>R. 12. 57.</ls> ({%b%}) Adversity’ need; स सुहृद् व्यसने यः स्यात् <ls>Pt. 1. 337</ls> ‘a friend in need is a friend indeed’. {@--6@} Setting (as of the sun &c.); तेजोद्वयस्य युगपद्व्यसनोदयाभ्यां <ls>Ś. 4. 1</ls> (where व्यसन means ‘a fall’ also). {@--7@} Vice, bad practice, evil habit; मिथ्यैव व्यसनं वदंति मृगयामीदृग् विनोदः कुतः <ls>Ś. 2. 5</ls>, <ls>R. 18. 14</ls>; <ls>Y. 1. 310</ls>; (these vices are usually said to be ten; see <ls>Ms. 7. 47-48</ls>); समानशीलव्यसनेषु सख्यं <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls> {@--8@} Close or intent application, assiduous devotion; विद्यायां व्यसनं <ls>Bh. 2. 62</ls>, <ls n="Bh. 2.">63.</ls> {@--9@} Inordinate addiction. {@--10@} Crime, sin. {@--11@} Punishment. {@--12@} Inability, incompetency. {@--13@} Fruitless effort. {@--14@} Air, wind. {@--15@} Individuality.
